longDef.en: to be unable to remember a fact, something that happened, or how to do something

examples.en: I'm sorry, I've forgotten your name.
examples.cn: 对不起，我忘了你的名字。

examples.en: Let me write down that date before I forget it.
examples.cn: 在我忘记之前，让我把日期写下来吧。

examples.en: I completely forgot about Jenny's party.
examples.cn: 我完全忘记了詹妮的聚会。

examples.en: We had forgotten (that) she doesn't come on Thursdays.
examples.cn: 我们都忘了，她星期四都是不来的。

examples.en: I'm sorry, I was forgetting (= I had forgotten) (that) you would be away in August.
She would never forget seeing the Himalayas for the first time.
examples.cn: 她永远也不会忘记第一次看到喜马拉雅山时的情景。

examples.en: I've forgotten what you do next/how to do it.
examples.cn: 我忘了你下一步做什么／怎么做。

examples.en: I never forget a face (= I'm good at remembering people).

longDef.cn: 这是我们放书的地方，包括杂志和报纸。

examples.en: This is where we keep all the books, not forgetting the magazines and newspapers.
examples.cn: 这是我们放书的地方，包括杂志和报纸。

longDef.en: to not remember to do something

examples.en: Don't forget to lock the door.
Dad's always forgetting (to take) his pills.

longDef.en: to not bring something with you because you did not remember it

examples.en: I forgot my keys.
I forgot (= left) my wallet at home.

longDef.en: to stop thinking about someone or something

examples.en: He tried to forget her.
It seemed unlikely that the debt would ever be paid off so we just forgot (about) it.
examples.cn: 那笔债似乎不太可能偿还，所以我们就不再把它放在心上了。

longDef.en: to act in a socially unacceptable way because you have lost control of your emotions

examples.en: He was so angry he forgot himself and swore loudly.
examples.cn: 他太生气了，就不成体统地破口大骂起来。

examples.en: I do apologize - I forgot myself!
I simply forgot myself for a moment - blame it on the wine.
In all the excitement, I forgot myself and threw my arms around him.
In his enthusiasm he was apt to forget himself, and he frequently had to apologize later.
John, forgetting himself, suddenly burst into song.
